column4: how can I uninstall just about everything, then install just xubuntu-desktop (obviously ubuntu-minimal needs to be there somewhere)?
I was contemplating using synaptic to mark everything for removal , then unmarking ubuntu-minimal, -standard and xubuntu-desktop, but it doesn't quite want to work that way
basicaly you just need to lookup the depends of ubuntu-minimal and substract them from the installed packages list, shouldnt be too hard i guess
